thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: The 10-Point.

author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
The Italian Job
European stocks were steady in morning trading today, following a selloff in Asia driven by Italy’s unfolding political drama. Italian President Sergio Mattarella’s decision to block the formation of a euroskeptic government spurred a global retreat from stocks Tuesday, with the Dow industrials dropping nearly 400 points while U.S. Treasurys had their best day in almost two years. Given the collapse in Italian bonds Tuesday—their worst day since at least 1989, when the data start—Journal senior...
